Unit.Name: Component selection and population subgrouping (SNMU + k-means clustering)
Unit.Description: Component selection followed by K-Means clustering of individuals based on their component exposure. K-means classifies individuals in multiple groups (i.e., clusters), such that individuals within the same cluster are as similar as possible (i.e., high intra-class similarity), whereas individuals from different clusters are as dissimilar as possible (i.e., low inter-class similarity). In k-means clustering, each cluster is represented by its center (i.e, centroid) which corresponds to the mean of points assigned to the cluster.
